sections.content: Quick FSP Labs use the familiar LED toggle (Blinky) function to demonstrate key techniques for developing with FSP and the e2 studio ISDE. Quick FSP Labs typically use Blinky to demonstrate new modules and their key features- such as timers, serial communications, low power, memory interface, USB, and Ethernet- while also introducing key tool capabilities for improving coding efficiency, speeding project debugging and other helpful tool oriented tricks and techniques.

Quick FSP Labs include complete step by step instructions that make them easy to complete in only about 15 to 20 minutes. All you need to get started on your first Quick FSP Lab is an EK-RA6M3 or EK-RA6M4 (for the most recent versions) Evaluation Kit, along with e2 studio and FSP installed on your PC. You can find instructions for obtaining these here:
FSP and e2 studio Installation: Can be found on the GitHub FSP site.
Quick FSP Labs are targeted for specific FSP releases. You can find the available labs for your releases below.
Quick FSP Labs for FSP release 0.8
Quick FSP Labs for FSP release 1.0.0
Quick FSP Labs for FSP release 1.1.0
Quick FSP Labs for FSP Release 1.3.0
Quick FSP Labs for FSP Release 2.0.0
Quick FSP Labs for FSP Release 3.0.0
Quick FSP Labs for FSP Release 4.6.0
